page.title: 16POPULATION IN ODDINGLEY
page.content:
The figures below show the populations of {Oddingley}and {Martin Hussingtree. You will notice that the populations are at their highest in 1841.This is typical of many villages and reflects the demand for labour on farms, and for rural crafts. The decline was due in part to the mechanisation of farming and also to the growing need for workers in industry which led to some migration from villages to towns like Worcester or Droitwich. { { { 1801 1841 1881 1931 1951 1981 }
{ODD}110 205 193 113 169 159
{M.H}194 237 169 181 216 208
.
